restaurant.name: Sylvias
restaurant.description: It's famous for asdffs

restaurant.name: Red Roosters
restaurant.description: The Tower of chicken! It is enough to feed like 6 people. Also a very nice and lively place

restaurant.name: Sottocasa
restaurant.description: V good pizza compared to Princeton's Nomad pizza - like actually, the best pizza i've ever had tbh. Nice staff and v cute environment and good enough for Italian people to eat here.

restaurant.name: Sugar Monk
restaurant.description: Fantastic vibe and great drinks. I had: Ugly beauty: citrus and black licorace flavor. Very good. My favorite. Memoey of the garden: earthy tons with citrus. Lenny had: Marie laveau: burbon, pomegranate, applewood smoke. Lenny's fav.  Campfire in a drink within a french bistro. Daphne's old fashion: really good old fashioned

restaurant.name: Harlem Burger Co.
restaurant.description: They have good french fries with the garlic sauce thing

restaurant.name: Mess Hall
restaurant.description: So-so bar. Really cramped and can be loud

restaurant.name: Lido
restaurant.description: They have a great mussels dish! Food overall is good and filling. Great cocktails

restaurant.name: Bo's Bagels
restaurant.description: Used to be here once a week minimum. bagels are A+! they are made fresh! Diane was the main cashier and is very friendly. Fav bagels: Chopped Cheese, The Ashley, the Uptown Vegan

restaurant.name: Harlem Tavern
restaurant.description: nice environment,  nice burgers - their veggie burgers are super big, calamari was excellent

restaurant.name: BLVD Bistro NY
restaurant.description: Kinda pricey but good food! Few veggie options. Ran into my study abroad classmate here once in 2019.

restaurant.name: Row House
restaurant.description: good mimosas and live music - alright brunch spot. they had a nice brunch menu deal back in 2019

restaurant.name: Cafe Frederick
restaurant.description: coffee in the morning and a hookah lounge at night. not many drink options here since it is mainly for hookah.

restaurant.name: Bean & Barley
restaurant.description: pretty alright hang out spot - lots of seating! They serve coffee earlier in the day and alcohol in the afternoon

restaurant.name: Melba's
restaurant.description: I think this is the sister location to Sylvia's. They have live music throughout the summer on the street on Sundays. Their food portions are kinda small for the price. I prefer Sylvia's

restaurant.name: Bier International
restaurant.description: closed in 2019. Was a great vibe and had beers that came in pints. Lenny and I went there for Christmas 2018 and they have us free sparkling wine. Their tacos were delicious

restaurant.name: Cantina Taqueria & Tequila Bar
restaurant.description: When they first opened in 2021, we knew everyone working there and their margaritas were always very strong. But management was bad and everyone we knew left; since then we haven't been back. They attract bad vibes and we wish they'd close. Their food is also bland.

restaurant.name: RDV-Rendezvous
restaurant.description: Cute color scheme and nice wine and cocktails for $6 during happy hour! Apparently they have all you can eat mussels on Wednesday starting at 5pm. They closed in 2019 though.

restaurant.name: Root Juicery of Harlem
restaurant.description: Favorite place to get acai bowls and healthy smoothies. Owner is really nice.

restaurant.name: Cafe Amrita
restaurant.description: They serve coffee in the morning and alcohol in the afternoon/evening + food. I have only gotten a chai here since they didn't have matcha. It was alright

restaurant.name: Blue Bottle Coffee
restaurant.description: A chain. Their matcha lattes are delicious since they don't premix in sugar. They also have seasonal drinks.

restaurant.name: Tartina
restaurant.description: Pastas are pretty good. They make their casse y peppe in a cheese wheel. The seafood could be better.

restaurant.name: The Hamilton
restaurant.description: Relaxing atmosphere, nice bartender, good selection of whiskey, gin and alcohol in general. The cocktails are pretty good.

restaurant.name: 108 Dried Hot Pot
restaurant.description: Dried hot pot is super good and flavorful. Dishes are big enough for 1 person (with leftovers) so it is nice to customize your hot pot for you

restaurant.name: Absolute Bagels
restaurant.description: Jewish people tend to say this is the best bagel place in the world/in New York. It is alright though, less topping options and the bagels are a bit chewy compared to Bo's Bagels

restaurant.name: Suma Sushi
restaurant.description: very OKay sushi place. nothing special about it, but nothing bad about it either. It is honestly pretty forgettable

restaurant.name: Ellington in the Park
restaurant.description: Great place to grab a quick bite and drink by the dog park. They close during the fall - spring though until it gets hot.

restaurant.name: Mama's TOO
restaurant.description: Really good pizza, reallt bready though. Takes forever to receive if ordering take out but come there and order by slice, it doesn't take as long. The casse y peppe pizza and poached pear pizza are pretty good. Also their classic margarita is great.

restaurant.name: The Ellington
restaurant.description: cute brunch spot. their brunch drinks are good and their quinoa salad was really great.

restaurant.name: Cafe de Soleil
restaurant.description: Brunch cocktails were $6! Smoked salmon was not bad. Staff was very friendly

restaurant.name: Naruto Romen
restaurant.description: A lot better than ivan ramen. Less salty than ivan ramen and the sake was really tasty

restaurant.name: Moonrise Izakaya
restaurant.description: Opened in fall of 2020, we used to frequent here because the food was always delicious. Their management was not good though

restaurant.name: Birch Coffee
restaurant.description: A chain, coffee is not bad.

restaurant.name: Pio Pio 6
restaurant.description: A chain. Pretty good and flavorful. Loved the tuna civiche and the chicken empanadas.

restaurant.name: Jacob's Pickles
restaurant.description: the pickle back shots were pretty good, so were the baked pickles. The mac and cheese is a must but is super filling and cheesy.

restaurant.name: E's Bar
restaurant.description: Had a frozen rosé here while waiting for seating at Jacob's Pickles. They are dog friendly

restaurant.name: Jin Ramen Upper West Side
restaurant.description: Handful of food options including ramen and rice bowls. None of the dishes are my favorite to get every time.

restaurant.name: Chalait UWS
restaurant.description: Lots of Matcha options! Had their boba matcha latte with a fruit flavor in it and was pretty good. Have been here numerous times and always get something new (it's a good thing because everything is good!).

restaurant.name: Senn Thai Comfort Food
restaurant.description: All their dishes are flavorful and delicious. One of my favorite thai spots. Their curries are all spicy and flavorful, their soft shell crab is delicious, Lenny always gets their chicken

restaurant.name: Caledonia Bar
restaurant.description: Nice, good for date or with a friend or two. Limited seating away from the bar. Cocktails were good

restaurant.name: Angaar Classic Indian Cuisine
restaurant.description: Affordable prices. Pretty good indian food. Service is a bit weird when sitting outside due to the bike lane in the middle.

restaurant.name: Lilly's Cocktail and Wine
restaurant.description: Nice aesthetic and drinks. Atmosphere is a bit crowded and loud.

restaurant.name: Zurruto
restaurant.description: they have garlic and butter edamame !!! <3 <3 the veggie miso ramen was pretty flavorful and non salty but it had kimchi in it which i feel like made the flavor a bit too much.

restaurant.name: Rosa Mexicano
restaurant.description: Really spacious restaurant with nice decorations. Food was so-so.

restaurant.name: Momofuku Noodle Bar Uptown
restaurant.description: Love the ginger ramen and mushroom ramen. Very flavorful vegatarian ramen, maybe the most flavorful veggie ramen I've ever had. Appetizers are all good and their desserts are delicious

restaurant.name: Tanoshi Sushi Sake Bar
restaurant.description: BYOB, beautiful place for omakase that is cheaper than other options. Only like 8 chairs per timeslot.

restaurant.name: Loco Coco
restaurant.description: My favorite acai bowl place in NYC! Even Lenny liked it and he hates vegetables and fruits haha

restaurant.name: Donburiya
restaurant.description: their udon soup was pretty good. there are like no veggie options though :(

restaurant.name: Quality Bistro
restaurant.description: Spicy ceasar was not spicy. Caviar was alright. Scallops and tuna tartar were pretty good.

restaurant.name: Ippudo Westside
restaurant.description: moderately flavorful vegetarian ramen  nice shrimp buns

restaurant.name: On the Rocks
restaurant.description: pricy whiskey bar, not really memorable in my opinion.

restaurant.name: Tsuru Ton Tan
restaurant.description: Giant Udon bowls! Their vegetable tempura udon bowl was pretty good. Apparently they have a daily happy hour at the bar - where they have a draft beer for $1.99

restaurant.name: Friedman's
restaurant.description: nice service and mimosas. few veggie options

restaurant.name: Doc's Oyster Bar
restaurant.description: Good starters! The brussel sprouts and cauliflower were really good. Fancy settings but some things seemed a bit dirty?

restaurant.name: MK Kareoke | Kareoke & Bar NYC
restaurant.description: Karaoke song book has a wide selection. hard to find the entrance because i don't think there was a sign? I liked the soju we had

restaurant.name: Food Gallery 32
restaurant.description: Lots of quick food options here, basically a food court. We usually get the Kung Fu Tea for boba.

restaurant.name: Miss Korea BBQ
restaurant.description: Their seafood dishes were pretty good. Didn't try the vegetable and seafood BBQ though. Overall an okay KBBQ place

restaurant.name: Woorijip
restaurant.description: Pretty cheap and delicious food for on the go! I think everything is homemade and you get a discount if you pay in cash. Their spicy tuna kimpop and kimchi fried rice is really good. We come here often for cheap good food when in Ktown.

restaurant.name: Jongro BBQ
restaurant.description: Their seafood pancake, kimchi and peach soju are very good. Whenever I eat here, I eat enough to not have to eat for the whole day.

restaurant.name: Space Kareoke Bar & Lounge
restaurant.description: Cheap prices for renting a room! Nice aesthetic of the overall place but kind of hard to find. It wasn't crowded. The peach soju was really good

restaurant.name: Debajo
restaurant.description: Every small dish here is delicious, especially the tostada. Highly recommend going with a group of 4 or 5 and ordering 1 or every dish and share.

restaurant.name: Eataly NYC Flatiron
restaurant.description: A great marketplace for high quality meat and cheese. They have a few restaurants and we had delicious wine and appetizers.

restaurant.name: Xi'an Famous Foods 西安名吃
restaurant.description: A chain of affordable, delicious chinese food. I don't think they have vegetarian options though

restaurant.name: Thai Villa
restaurant.description: After years of trying to go here, we were finally able to check it out. Beautiful aesthetics - it is featured as a set of Master of None. The food was delicious, my favorite was the scallop appetizer. They even had chicken pandan that Lenny loved. The drinks were really nice, had the lcyheetini that had a strong lychee flavor.

restaurant.name: Roth Bar
restaurant.description: Inside a book store - kind of hard to find. Very cute - really good kale salad!

restaurant.name: Txikito
restaurant.description: I actually am not sure if we have been there before lol

restaurant.name: Los Taco No. 1
restaurant.description: Located in Chelsea Market (with several locations across NYC), the best quick taco place. Super flavorful and cactus as a protein option. I always get their deep freid quesadilla with cactus. Lenny always gets their pork.

restaurant.name: The Standard Biergarten
restaurant.description: A Beirgarten technically with a wide selection of beer. The space is large and attracts a bunch of loud people looking to party.

restaurant.name: Van Leeuwen Ice Cream
restaurant.description: They have like 8 vegan flavors! They were all very good. Lenny always gets the classic strawberry ice cream.

restaurant.name: The Garrett
restaurant.description: When we went it was too crowded to enjoy it much. They have a large selection of strong cocktails

restaurant.name: Houston Hall
restaurant.description: A beer hall, lots of selection of beer and a wide space. Attracts a bunch of loud people. Not a vibe if you're looking for something chill, romantic and relaxing.

restaurant.name: Amelie Wine and Beer
restaurant.description: Very nice atmosphere & the appetizers were good. the chocolate mousse paired with the staff member's recommended dessert wine was v good. Seating farther back was quieter than the front that was crowded and had a bar

restaurant.name: Blue Note Jazz Club
restaurant.description: Pricy food and drink but you get to enjoy incredible jazz musicians. The setting is pretty intimate and hard to get good seats without waiting in line for a long time.

restaurant.name: Sushi Katsuei
restaurant.description: Incredible intimate place to enjoy omakase, made right in front of you. Very pricy but worth it for special occasions. The staff is very attentive and the sushi is mouthwatering.

restaurant.name: Proletariat
restaurant.description: Beer hall with exclusively very unique beer selections. Pretty small space but excellent vibes. One of our first date spots.

restaurant.name: Cha-An
restaurant.description: Japanese gourmet desserts. Seating place to enjoy Cha-An BonBon desserts. Everything is very aesthetic and delicious.

restaurant.name: Sake Bar Decibel
restaurant.description: underground sake bar with grungy aesthetics. The sake selection is never ending and they have small dishes as well.

restaurant.name: Veselka
restaurant.description: The pierogis literallt melt in your mouth. Staff is lovely and there is always a long line to get in.

restaurant.name: Chickalicious Dessert Bar
restaurant.description: Really pretty desserts served a la carte. And you can pair it with their selection of wine.

restaurant.name: Momofuku Noodle Bar West Village
restaurant.description: They have the same food items as the other location in Columbus Circle. This one seems a bit less crowded and not as aesthetic. But still gets the job done! Has the most flavorful veggie ramen I've ever had.

restaurant.name: Mama Fina's
restaurant.description: As a filipino, the sisig here is incredible. They even have squid sisig and Red Horse beer. Their shrimp sinigang always hits the spot.

restaurant.name: Dream Baby Bar & Cocktail Parlour
restaurant.description: excellent music!!! nice space and clean bathroom. haven't tried the drinks though

restaurant.name: Bubbleology
restaurant.description: Their concept of alcoholic boba is cool in theory but the drinks were too sweet to really enjoy.

restaurant.name: Dun Well Doughnuts
restaurant.description: Their donuts are all delicious, we especially liked the strawberry donuts. Not too sweet.

restaurant.name: Hanoi House
restaurant.description: Specializes in phu. Their veggie phu was incredibly flavorful and delicious. Lenny still dreams about their bone marrow phu that had a huge peice of bone marrow sticking out of it.

restaurant.name: Superiority Burger
restaurant.description: They don't have french fries :( But their veggie burger is way better than their wrap (that has tofu & rice). Also their wrap is lowkey spicy.

restaurant.name: Lovers of Today
restaurant.description: A crowded, small cocktail bar but will forever hold a special place in our hearts since it was one of our first date spots.

restaurant.name: Altro Paradiso
restaurant.description: pretty good brunch food and great wine. Nice ensemble and nice staff! None of the food really stood out.

restaurant.name: Socarrat Paella Bar - Nolita
restaurant.description: Specializing in paella. This was my first introduction to Paella. Their squid ink paella is incredibly delicious.

restaurant.name: Zhen Wei Fang
restaurant.description: They allow for individual hot pot but their veggie options are lacking. I had a veggie base and the hot pot was bland.

restaurant.name: BAR GOTO
restaurant.description: very cute date spot! Though kind of dark and hard to see. the cauliflower tater tots are delicious and the cocktail selections are aesthetically pleasing and very good!

restaurant.name: Okiboru House of Tsukemen
restaurant.description: Absolutely delicious tsukemen, it is even a michelin starred restaurant. They have only a few dishes available but all of them are incredible.

restaurant.name: Kind Regards
restaurant.description: Nice aesthetic, nice bartenders, nice music. Owner of the bar was a nice guy named Noel Wellington. But filled with annoying rude people

restaurant.name: Nite Cap
restaurant.description: lite by candlelight. was a bit crowded when we got there but we got seating shortly after being there. specializing in cocktails, the cocktails we had were good! staff members all wore floral patterned shirts

restaurant.name: Windmill
restaurant.description: Their shrimp toast is excellent. the environment is very cute and the staff is friendly.

restaurant.name: Ivan Ramen
restaurant.description: Theres a chef's table episode of this. The veggie ramen was really salty though :(

restaurant.name: Alimama Tea
restaurant.description: their mochi donuts are incredible - with the choice of chocolate or matcha topping. they also have boba tea filled cream puffs. you can buy the pastries in dozens.

restaurant.name: El Vez and Burrito Bar
restaurant.description: Really good tacos and margaritas! not sure if there are good vegetarian options though.

restaurant.name: The Grey Dog
restaurant.description: A cute dog friendly chain. The food was kind of bland though, nothing very memorable about that.

restaurant.name: Clinton Hall
restaurant.description: A beer hall. Lots of FiDi people frequent here. Could be a nice place to hang out with friends but definitely not a date spot. There is a great selection of beer. There is seating outside and board games.

restaurant.name: Underdog
restaurant.description: pretty big seating and very clean! Definitely not a bar for people in their early 20s. Gave off a more mature vibe.

restaurant.name: Nan Xiang Xiao Long Bao
restaurant.description: Affordable delicious soup dumplings, even some vegetarian dumpling options but all the soup dumplings have pork or chicken.

restaurant.name: Kulu Desserts
restaurant.description: Affordable and good desserts! Lots of dairy in them though.

restaurant.name: Diamond Dogs
restaurant.description: BYOB food and a large outdoor yard. The cocktails are good and seasonal.

restaurant.name: Pye Boat Noodle
restaurant.description: Great noodles and drinks.

restaurant.name: Madame Marie's
restaurant.description: Affordable drinks and small space. We went here early 2020 Pandemic where they had to serve food with the drink, so we got some homemade simple PB&Js to go with it.

restaurant.name: Kora
restaurant.description: Filipino bakery with donuts filled with Filipino flavors. Very hard to get an order since you have to  order in advance and pick it up. They sell out immediately when orders become available. We love the ube ones the most!

restaurant.name: Focal Point Beer Co
restaurant.description: Nice selection of beer. Nice seating area. Nice place for boardgames. They allow dogs!

restaurant.name: Takumen
restaurant.description: Really great poke bowls and ramen

restaurant.name: Oxomoco
restaurant.description: Their appetizers, dishes and drinks are all fantastic. They also have 1 michellin star

restaurant.name: Radegast Hall & Biergarten
restaurant.description: A biergarten. Crowded and noisy, they had a few games to play though.

restaurant.name: Andante
restaurant.description: Ramen is so-so, nothing memorable about it unfortunately. But a solid choice if you want ramen and are in the area.

restaurant.name: Lucky Dog
restaurant.description: Has a nice outdoor space for playing games and chilling with dogs. A nice place to socialize and drink.

restaurant.name: Union Pool
restaurant.description: A typical beer hall atmosphere with some games to play and plenty of space to socialize. But they only have a single toilet!

restaurant.name: OKONOMI // YUJI Ramen
restaurant.description: Pretty solid ramen place, nothing too memorable for me though.

restaurant.name: The Four Horsemen
restaurant.description: Wine bar named after the 4 horsemen of the apocolypse. Has small plates and nice ambience.

restaurant.name: The Stonewall Inn
restaurant.description: Rich in history for LGBT rights, this bar was cozy and nice. Only 2 toilets in total though. But upstairs features live entertainment and the drinks are good.

restaurant.name: The Rookery Bar
restaurant.description: New american grub bar, it is so-so. Apparently they do brunch which we didn't experience.

restaurant.name: Gold Sounds Bar
restaurant.description: We watched a show here while enjoying wine. It is laid back and not too loud. Perfect for a calm, relaxing evening listening to music.

restaurant.name: Roberta's
restaurant.description: A pizza place that is not bad. They have several locations in NYC

restaurant.name: Syndicated Bar Theater Kitchen
restaurant.description: A huge space, we were here for a birthday. Took awhile to get served. We didn't watch a show while there.

restaurant.name: Good Judy
restaurant.description: Similar layout to Stonewall Inn. A good selection of cocktails that were pretty good. They have live entertainment on the 2nd floor.

restaurant.name: The Double Windsor
restaurant.description: A nice, family friendly, American pub. Had burgers and their drinks were beer and hard selzter.

restaurant.name: Covenhoven
restaurant.description: cute hangout spot and a wide selection of beer! perfect for hanging out with a group of friends.

restaurant.name: Threes Brewing
restaurant.description: nice beer selection and nice aesthetic

restaurant.name: Dino
restaurant.description: Lots of pastas, their squid ink pasta was incredible!

restaurant.name: Long Island Bar
restaurant.description: Good amount of space with a nice aesthetic. They had a large selection of cocktails, wine and beer

restaurant.name: GRAN ELÉCTRICA
restaurant.description: Went here for a work dinner. The food was pretty tasty but can't remember anything in specific lol.

restaurant.name: Celestine
restaurant.description: Pricy but worth it for special occasions. Nice view by the water overlooking Manhattan and I still think about the tuna med-rare steak.

restaurant.name: Lady M
restaurant.description: Incredibly delicious crepe cakes, we love the green tea flavor the most. Pricy though so good for special occasions.

restaurant.name: Levain Bakery
restaurant.description: A chain. Well known for their huge cookies that take a few days to finish. The cookies are not too sweet. My favorite is double chocolate.

restaurant.name: Magnolia Bakery
restaurant.description: A chain. We always get their mini cheesecakes (we love the red velvet flavor) and the banana puding.
